title: Are Apple-certified refurbished products good? - Quora

response.answer_text: The officially recognized refurbishment, with a formal refurbishment process and quality inspection process, ensures that the refurbished products will be as new as they are, while still enjoying the warranty service.  Take the refurbished iPhone as an example. After entering the official website of Apple, enter the word “refurbished” in the search box, when the user clicks into this page, they can see the "Guaranteed Apple quality." officially certified refurbished page. It can be seen that the official refurbished iPhone sold by Apple is the officially tested and certified by Apple, replaced with a new product shell and battery, and recycled through a regular channel. Its appearance, function and configuration are exactly the same as the original model, and enjoy 1 year warranty service and lower price. In fact, there are many companies selling refurbished iPhones on the market. They are also very strict in the recycling and testing of refurbished iPhones. They will sure all the devices they are wholesaling are clean and coming from a legitimate source. Wakephone. Wakephone, is a reliable used and refurbished smartphones wholesaler, and also have the way to get refurbished iPhones certified.

Apple’s refurbished products are indistinguishable from new products except they come in a plain brown box. They have the full warranty and have no blemishes or scratches, and function like brand new products. Please search before asking, Johnanth Fallie. The past few Apple products in our family, outside of iPhones, were refurbished. Apple makes sure to fully review and replace any bad components in the refurbished item. Plus, according to their website, it also will contain a new battery and new back shell. You're essentially getting a brand new device. Like a new device, you also get good coverage from Apple for the first 3 months and the option for AppleCare+ to extend that. All of that is essentially the same as a new device. The only difference? The price.

Yes. Nearly every Apple product I've bought with my own money has been a refurb. Statistically I'd say they are as good as or better than brand new. Think of the refurb as a new product that has gone through an additional round of quality control. Apple is giving it the same warranty as a new machine, and they are giving you a discount. It's a no-brainer.

It's barely one step below from being brand new.  Factory brand new devices are assembled at the factory out of new parts which are thoroughly tested and go through rigorous quality control, then tested, packaged, and sold the customer.  Factory refurbished products are disassembled, all defective parts are replaced or repaired, the device goes through the same rigorous quality control, maybe even more, tested, packaged, and sold/given to the customer. There is functionally no difference. Refurbished machines can have no physical defects or wear and tear and are essentially brand new. This goes for the refurbished devices that they sell and the ones they use as in repairs.

Yes, you can go for Apple-certified pre-owned phones, which means that the company provides a complete detail check of the original parts of the phone. But with other retailers, you may not be sure about the quality of the replaced parts. Anyway, before taking delivery and accepting the delivery without any review, please check the condition of the product and check properly and if possible make a video while doing so and be satisfied with it only accept the product after it is done. Even a few days ago I bought a refurbished iPhone from Zanooz which I liked very much. Even, according to their website, the phone has a new battery and a new back shell. So we are essentially getting a new device because they are supervised by experts. They provide the 12 months warranty and 3months good coverage facility just like a new device.
